Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ChesterNipper
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed here for our wedding anniversary in March 2012 and really enjoyed it. It's right next to a vaporetti stop on the route 1 and right by a cavaletto stop too. It has a beautiful courtyard garden where the friendly staff will serve you a drink, or you can sit in the next door hotel and watech the Grand Canal's coming's and going's. Our room was really nice and clean, bed comfortable and mini bar well stacked. My only complaint is the lack of coffee making facilities in the room. I much prefer to make my own drink, rather than call room service and answer the door with a hangover!

Reviews.Title: “Good location with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: alicia18
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but clean with good bed linen. Breakfast was okay compared to others we've had in Italy. Front of house staff rude and arrogant.

Reviews.Title: “1 night in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ramanda_12 Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location for weary travelers! The Vaporetto stop is right next to the hotel - so it is very easy to find. The rooms are small, but very cozy. The bathroom is clean and nice - with good products. The bed linens are also very good. We had a nice view over the city. It was always easy to walk around because the hotel is located in an ideal location - close to san marco and the sights. The breakfast was fabulous and the lounge room adorable. The only down side is there is no free wifi and the computer/printer is very old and slow.

Reviews.Title: “Two days in Venice is enough”
Reviews.Author: Hollandexpat
Reviews.Content: Accompanied a family member (also a friend) on a trip to Venice and spent two days there. Hotel is in a big old venetian house, thus the rooms are not large but reasonably comfortable. As others have commented, the location is nice with a waterbus stop in front of the hotel. Breakfast is not very elaborate, but the quality is OK. Our room was located on the side of the building, with just a little view on the canal.

Reviews.Title: “Location is tops!”
Reviews.Author: travellingmama1
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a really wonderful trip to Italy (Venice, Florence, Rome) last weekend and I cannot say enough about how much I loved the location of NH Manin. Venice was our first city-stop in Italy. After almost 24 hours of traveling (2 planes, 1 train and 1 vaporetto), it was wonderful to just dump our bags, take a quick shower and head on out to explore Venezia. Venice is a city to "get lost in" and I mean that both literally and figuratively. Having a hotel just right beside the vaporetto stop (Sant' Angelo) made it so convenient for us- especially during those times when we actually couldn't find our way back. It was so easy to just hop on a vaporetto and head back to Sant' Angelo. It was also wonderful not having to drag our heavy suitcases thru cobble stone steps because the hotel is right across where you get off from the boat. Very convenient indeed! For the price, NH Manin offers a really good breakfast buffet complete with prosecco. It felt like such a treat waking up in the morning and heading to the breakfast room, knowing that you can have a glass of bubbly with bread, cheese and fruit. I would gladly recommend NH Manin to travelers visiting Venice for the first time. Hotel rooms are clean and well-maintained. We also got a room that was looking out to the grand canal. The bathroom was a decent size and had all the amenities that we needed. Looking forward to visiting Venice again soon and staying at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average, but good value for money”
Reviews.Author: 187147Rob
Reviews.Content: If you keep your expectations low, then you will like this. The only negative was service, especially at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find!”
Reviews.Author: BoyTv
Reviews.Content: I LOVED staying at this hotel after my cruise. I really picked it right. Our private water taxi pulled right up to the launch at the front door. Amazing experience. The hotel is right next to the #2 Vaporetto, and it is also one of the line stops for the shared water taxis to the airport for 16 euros payable on board or 15 euros in advance. You are two stops to the Rialto Bride and you can see that bridge from outside the hotel. I was thrilled to get room 001 on the ground floor upfront. I had a Grand, Grand Canal view. I threw open the double window and was able to stand in the window. There was a short balustrade at the bottom of the window which made standing seem like I was on a french balcony. I could throw a coin and hit the valporetto from there, you are that close! Plus the canal is bending like a boomerang, so you have a sweeping panoramic view of the canal. The hotel has a beautiful inner court yard with table, chairs and umbrellas for outdoor dining with your included breakfast. Breakfast was very nice with cappuccino made to order, check out the ceiling in that breakfast room/bar. They also had a beautiful reading room with all the newspapers on poles, etc. I loved the staff and Luca at the front desk was calm under pressure. I cannot wait to stay here again and next time for much longer.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: ricjoa
Reviews.Content: Nice accommodations, excelent location in the Grand Canal (San Marco), in front of a vaporetto station. Friendly staff, nice breakfast but expensive room rate (as they all are if you want to sleep in Venice).

Reviews.Title: “A great week at the MANIN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: chris c
Reviews.Content: The restoration to this former palace is evident in its visual and attendant good service. The staff are so very helpful and friendly with good knowledge of their city. They are attentive, professional and are happy in their work. It is very well managed. The room was very nice with comfortable beds and all facilities acceptable and with good housekeeping. It is clean, quiet and peaceful. The range of breakfast foods on offer is large and very acceptable. The two lifts are small but quite adequate and are at right-angles to each other and a most welcome facility. The San Angelo waterbus landing stage is very close to the front door and is a good service. The Manin is very convenient for getting about Venice. The garden would be a nice amenity to enjoy if one can put up with the pigeons that infest the place. They cannot be killed by some querky legal rules - no surprise when St Marks is so grossly infested by the birds - fed by the tourists who buy the bird food from a squad of sellers there.This is a shameful state as there are laws that prohibit feeding pigeons there. The city is suffering from the guano and one can see the stone work being eaten away by this. Since we were here in Venice four years ago, the waterbus vaparetti have improved with better displays of destinations and recorded messages. The introduction of the OYSTER type prepaid travel cards make moving about Venice a real adventure and is good value for money. The Manin Hotel is such a pleasure to stay in for a holiday that we would recommend it to everyone that we know. The plans to save Venice from any further sinking or flooding by the government we hope and trust will work as it seems to be the answer to such a vast problem that has been the trouble for so long. The combined efforts of THOMSON + CITALIA + BRITISH AIRWAYS made a great holiday for us. We will be back to Venice next year - and to the Manin Hotel for another pleasant holiday. Chris and Sylvia Cole.

Reviews.Title: “Good value city hotel”
Reviews.Author: CTom23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated on the Grand canal near to the Rialto bridge. It has it's own docking station and is right next to a Vaporetto station (Water bus stop). The rooms are a reasonable size, well maintained and clean. Breakfast was good and staff very helpful. It is a good value city hotel, although Venice is very expensive overall. Well placed for exploring Venice.It was Carnival time whilst we were there and that is a great experience. There is a chain of Manin hotels so you can get rewards for using them.Whilst it was not luxury it is certainly a good standard hotel and we would return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and fantastic hotel in beautiful Venice”
Reviews.Author: gizz1967
Reviews.Content: What you get from this hotel is what you pay for, from the excellent stop of the boat which is then 50 yards into your hotel. The entrance into the reception says it all, very impressive, we arrived 4 hours late but we where made to feel very welcome from the first minute, we had a deluxe standard room and paid 900 euros for 4 nights/5 days, the room had lovely beams in the ceiling, very large, beautiful bathroom and the breakfast was so lovely in the outdoor garden. We paid 4 euros each person for the new tourist tax now been introduced at this hotel. Lovely hotel and would recommend to all my family and friends

Reviews.Title: “over looking the canals in venice, italy: picture perfect hotel~”
Reviews.Author: navawritz
Reviews.Content: when you are about to take a cruise from Venice Italy, you are so thankful for being so lucky you tent to find everything "rosier." yet i think this hotel is really a boutique type very quint and friendly service. the breakfast was served in the court yard, however the heat was not really a plus in outdoor setting without a fan. the food was not as good as we were hoping and the coffee was real American type. smiling we didn't come all the way from America to italy to drink bad American coffee. having saying that i will still recommend the hotel . as the level of heat was not a norm in Venice it was our luck. smiling it is a good hotel in a good spot. you have a water bus just outside. to sense that great city of lovers. which we were. lucky us.~

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: LeonPomeroy
Reviews.Content: We selected the NHManin as it was centrally located, watertaxi stop right outside, and because it was my wife's birthday, we wanted a hotel with balcony room overlooking the Grand Canal. Couldn't have made a better choice. Friendly and helpful staff, perfect spoken English, a wonderful room with a huge 6' bed that was SO comfortable! Spotlessly clean everywhere, nice bathroom with good pressure shower, big fluffy bathrobes and great views. Breakfast is taken in a gorgeous walled garden, huge buffet as well as scrambled eggs and bacon! Location is perfect, looking up to the Rialto, and only 10 minutes walk to St Marks. Highly highly recommended and we would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive”
Reviews.Author: Valerie_shl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nicely located on the grand canal. The staff were friendly but lacked the level of service expected of a 380$/night hotel. The room had very little space to move around. Breakfast was included and was very nice - served in a patio/garden with good variety of hot and cold options. It was a very very simple hotel, with good service and good internet/wifi connection. Over priced.more

Reviews.Title: “Over priced hotel - Good location”
Reviews.Author: MLKNN
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nicely located on the grand canal. The staff were friendly but lacked the level of service expected of a 300 Euro/night hotel. The rooms were decently decorated with very little space to move around. Breakfast was included with the room and was very nice - served in a patio/garden with good variety of hot and cold options. It was a very very simple hotel, with good service and good internet/wifi connection. Over priced.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: AlgyD
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Venice where we stayed at the NH Manin hotel and we throroughly enjoyed it. It is just steps away from the vaparetto stop which meant we found it immediately. However, we did get lost later on that evening but eventually found our way by following the All Academia street signs part of the way. Staff were very helpful and pleasant and breakfast was excellent, we often had our coffee outside in the sunny garden.

Reviews.Title: “A fairytale of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: CateMunch
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite at NH Manin hotel for four nights from 24/09/2009. We asked for a balcony and a view if possible, and what a view !!! The hotels position is abolutely perfect, right on the Grand Canal, and with a fantastic view to the Rialto Bridge. The breakfastroom in the backyard was very pleasant. Thank you to the manager Koldo Salazar, for making our trip to Venice a magic trip to remember.

Reviews.Title: “great location, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mauouo
Reviews.Content: I stayed over the NH Manin for two nights in early January 2011. My faithful experience of the place is summerized below. The location is great on the "Canal Grande", just aside the Sant'Angelo stop of the boat. I stayed in a standard room on the side of the hotel. Only suites, actually, have a view on the Canal, so better know that in advance. At the same time, those same rooms are probably more noisy, since you can hear distincly the boats manoeuvering at the Sant'angelo stop. The second floor of the hotel is thus to be preferred, if possible. The hotel location is great, only a few minutes walk from Rialto bridge, San Marco, Ponte dell'Accademia. Campo San Maurizio e Campo Santo Stefano are also close by, there you can find food shops, bars, restaurants. A nice and quiet neighbourhood. The personnel of the Hotel is very kind and helpful. The room was cold on the first night, we had to increase the room temperature and thus have the heating run, for a while, at night, a nuisance, since the air conditioning/heating system is noisy. The room was quite large though for Venice standards, with a huge bed. The furniture was a bit old though, below expectations. The breakfast was plentiful and good, basically a real meal. Overall, IMO, the hotel has an attracting price-to-quality ratio.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - a bit skimpy for 4*”
Reviews.Author: Trellecktwo
Reviews.Content: Double room a bit small but nice view over the courtyard behind. Staff helpful enough but did not do anything more than the minimum to accommodate us. Plenty to eat at breakfast. Vaparetto stop right outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Oilfan4life
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple nights before leaving on a cruise out of Venice. Getting to the hotel was surprisingly easy - it is right at a waterbus stop 6 euros each way. I heard some guests complaining of how much the water taxi was (60-70 euros) but there really isn't a need. Breakfast was above average for european continental spreads. We explored all around the area, take a map to prevent walking in circles. Takes about 15mins to get to Marc's square and Rialto bridge. View was crummy for the few hours we were in the room so we has a beer next door on the patio and watched the water action. Free internet as well was nice. Very unique city - Venice. Overall we had a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Elegance”
Reviews.Author: RCMaui
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real find! It's historical facts are so interesting. It's atmosphere is both elegant and relaxing. The terrace for breakfast is delightful, and the food delicious. The staff is so professional and pleasant and speak many languages. A little difficult to find, but once you do - it is a pleasure to "come home" to after a day shopping eating and enjoying beautiful Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: JLW2010
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel my husband and I stayed at during our honeymoon in Italy and it was our favorite! The hotel staff was nice, our room was clean, the bed in our room was 2 twins pushed together, but was very comfortable. We did not have any issues with noise. And the location was perfect, right in between San Marco Plaza and the Rialto Market. Getting here was extremely easy, just take the Line 1 ferry from Plaza Roma (across from the train station) to the San Angelo stop in front of the hotel. We considered staying in the Jr. Suite, but they were unavailable. So, we stayed in the Deluxe suite which we were much happier with. We had a private balcony with a table and 3 chairs that faced the Grand Canal (note: I don't think all Deluxe rooms are on the Canal side of the building, so be sure to ask)! From what we saw, the Jr. Suite does not have a balcony you can sit on, just doors that face the canal. Our room was a good size, not as large as hotels in the US/Canada (or the Jr. Suite), however it was plenty big as much of our days were spent exploring Venice. The breakfast buffet was the best we had of the 3 hotels we stayed at. You get 1 hour per day of wireless internet for free, after that you have to pay. Overall, we definitely recommend this hotel for couples! It was a little pricey, but the view and location were worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Janso0204
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Manin with my 2 sisters for a weekend break. We had two lovely twin rooms on the ground floor. My room overlooked the rear garden/terrace. the rooms were simply furnished but lovely and clean and comfortable, I had a bath with shower over, the other had a shower cubicle (and I have to say a decent hairdryer!). Breakfast was very good, with fresh fruit eg strawberries, kiwi, melon etc. plus a selection of hams, cheese, rolls etc and pastries and made even better by being able to sit out on the terrace under large brollies - this is my 2nd stay in Venice and found the outside area a fantastic plus point for the hotel. Once we found our way around it was very handy for all the sights. Staff on the whole were very helpful, although service int he bar in the evening was a little slow to say the least, and not quite sure what they would do if there was a rush on! Whilst expensive I really do think that it is worth arriving by water taxi from the airport which drops you right outside the door (there is also a waterbus stop at the door too). All in all a very enjoyable weekend and I think I will probably return with hubby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Grand Canal Location, Great Bfast Buffet, Clean but Tight Room”
Reviews.Author: VirgniaBiztrvlr
Reviews.Content: I posted a photo of the water taxi in front of the hotel and a photo of our room. We stayed at the NH Manin for two nights in April 2010. Once you familiarize yourself with the walking route to St. Mark's Square from the hotel, it is not a bad location. However, it is much better for those who want to use the water bus (vaporetto) to get around. If you have started to look at the vaporetto routes and map, it may help to know that the San Angelo (S. Angelo) station is right in front of the hotel. If you take a water taxi from the airport, it will drop you off right at your front door. Or, if you take a train it is only a few water bus stations away. Great location! Our room was small. The shower was standing room only (no tub) but the bathroom facilities were more than adequate. There was a bidet and plenty of toiletries. We had two tall windows that we could open for fresh air. Our room overlooked the garden. The Manin provided an excellent breakfast buffet. Be sure to get downstairs in time to enjoy it. Prosecco, three fresh juices, coffee drinks made to order, prosciutto, cheeses, baked goods, eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. We didn't see the bar open but we brought in our own wine from outside, and drank it at a little table in the garden one evening and no one minded. As with all hotels in Italy, bring your own travel alarm clock if you want to have a clock in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Small room - awful view”
Reviews.Author: Katergo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NH Manin for 2 nights in january. Location is perfect between San Marco sq and the Rialto bridge. Breakfast is fine. We were however disappointed with the room which was very small. The worst was the view. Just look at the pictures. We paid just below 100 â‚¬ / night, betting on priceline. I would not pay more to see a wall and cigarette ends when I look through the window. Service was also average. We had booked a restaurant in Fondamente Nove (Algiubagio, excellent). We asked for our directions at reception ... and got completely wrong indications !

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: kikik0k0
Reviews.Content: Good location for water bus. The breakfast is very fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good option in a great location”
Reviews.Author: aknla
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights here in October. This hotel has a good location--a short walk from many of the main Venice sights and only about 10 meters from a vaporetto stop. We found the staff friendly and helpful. We had a fairly basic room with no view (which we got a fantastic deal on through Expedia); the bath was a good size by Italian standards and the bed was the standard two twins pushed together. The breakfast had a few more options than the usual offerings. The hotel also has a nice patio, but we didn't see it being used much as it was October. Overall, I would recommend this hotel, especially if you can secure it at a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but needs to train staff in the breakfast room and bar.”
Reviews.Author: scorpionlimerick
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights in the nh manin with my girlfriend for my birthday. If staying at the hotel when you arrive at marco polo airport get the alilaguna line boat direct to the hotel for just 13 euros. Arived late on a sunday night and were giving our room on the second floor. Room 203 a suite with a great view of the grand canal. The room was nice and big with a huge bed and was very clean. The hotel is only a small walk away from the rialto bridge and san marco square. The two things i did not like about the hotel was the breakfast staff. There was one member of staff who gave out to us on our third morning there. We had taken 2 yogurts with us up to the room but it seems this is against the rules. When we came for breakfast the male staff member gave out to us in front of the other guests which was not right. I paid 1300 euro to stay at this hotel for 5 nights and i dont like to treated in that way. Another thing was the bar at the hotel which closes at 2330 hours. The female staff member kept leaving the bar at 2320 hours when other guests came into the bar they could not get a drink. I went to the front desk to say this but was told she had to go away. So what this hotel needs to do is train there staff to stay until there time is up so guests can get a drink at the time they say they are open until. I would not stay at this hotel again if i came back to venice but i did like the room and how easy it is to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Lesson_learned
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a location you would want if you knew about it. Rooms are modern but the public spaces are keeping with its former life as a theater and palazzo. The vaporetto stop is not only convenient (right in front) for getting there from the train but anytime you want to go somewhere (get a pass when you buy your first ticket). The NH Hoteles train there staff very well in every hotel and this is an example. We were given room 3 on floor 0, facing the canal. It was lovely, with double panes of glass and big curtains and modern furnishing with a marble floor. The breakfast was first class with prosciutto, eggs, fresh fruit, and cereal. We walked a lot once we knew our way and used the vaporetto to go to dinner at San Palo - recommended by the friendly young lady at the front desk. The garden is beautiful but you have to fight off the pigeons or your breakfast will be gone. We got this on Priceline with a 4* bid - I would not have known about it to select from a list. But I can't imagine doing better,

Reviews.Title: “Excellently located hotel”
Reviews.Author: DALIZ12
Reviews.Content: We will certainly return to this hotel primarily because of the situation on the Grand canal. On arrival (early evening) we were disappointed to be allocated a room on the top floor which had very low ceiling beams directly above our bed.We therefore requested a change of room which was done the next day -new room allocated was very good. Breakfast at this hotel is very good and we found most of the staff very friendly and helpful. Be sure to take a travel iron and maybe drink making equipment as these are not supplied by the hotel. Vaporetto and Allilangua stop only a few metres from hotel.A map of central Venice is provided at the front desk and any requests for directions etc.are given in a friendly manner To sum up a very well located hotel with well trained polite staff and we would have no hesitation in recommending this for a visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “room rate would decide my next stay here”
Reviews.Author: AutumnHillFarm
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Manin - the last was Aug 2006. I got a spectacular rate through Expedia because we booked for 4 nights. When I emailed to confirm the rate, the Manin upped the rate, saying that the rate we got did not include breakfast. They would not budge. I caved- because the rate was still very good. We got what we paid for - not a small suite with a balcony, but a tiny room overlooking terracotta roof tiles. Well, okay. It was clean, the aircon worked very well. The location (location, location, location!!!) was unbeatable, and the garden for breakfast just as enchanting as we remembered. We noted (and took advantage of) a new trend. The garden is open until 2330 hours for drinks. We ended up out there every night for a nightcap. And it seemed the rest of the hotel did the same. At 2200 not a table was taken...but 1/2 an hour later every one was full. We met some lovely folks this way and had engaging conversations. In various languages - there were few Americans at this hotel, though English is spoken very well by the staff, and was used as a common denominator with a lot of the other nationalities. Room rate would play a large part of another stay. I would NOT pay 235 euro for the room we had. And perhaps we would not have been given it if that's the rate we had paid.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything in Venice...”
Reviews.Author: gamera06
Reviews.Content: That was my second trip to Venice, first one for my wife. I knew that location in Venice is a key factor. The Vaporetto #1 stops at 8.5 meters from the hotel entrance ! From Marco Polo Airport it is a real pleasure to take the Alilaguna Arancia line and you stop directly at San Angelo stop: no walking or bridge climbing with your luggage !!! If you come by train, the Vaporetto will bring you there too. From the hotel you can easily walk to San Marco, Rialto bridge, Academia bridge. And the Vaporetto will bring you everywhere else ! Choosing this hotel with prevent you to hire the costly water taxis. The garden was really nice & peaceful for breakfast. I'm European, and especially French, so I can tell you that freshly baked (frozen) viennoiseries (croissants, pains au chocolat, pains au raisins) are good: it is not as good as freshly baked one, but it is what an international hotel can offer without having a chef ! We stayed in room #4 at the ground floor. You have a direct view on the Gran Canale, but the room is a bit noisy. I could hear the janitor opening the closet or the front desk guy playing with his pen in the morning. You won't hear the boats or noise from the Canale because of the 2 windows. But their room doors are thin and there is a gape at the bottom. Service & Cleaning is really good. The rooms are smaller than standard chain hotels but keep in mind that it's a ancient building and it's Europe !

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: rjrmckinney
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Europe & we stayed at this hotel. Very, very convient to the Vaparetto, it practically stops at the front door of the hotel. I did see other people slepping their bags down the small streets of Venice. This is probably the best feature of the hotel. The rooms are extremely average, bathroom facilities are average, staff is very pleasant and helpful. After an all night flight across the Atlantic, they did let us check in early for a quick nap before we ventured out into the city. An average breakfast is included in the price. The hotel is a little pricy for what it is but that is true of the whole city of Venice. Bring a cell phone, 1 minute call to the US using the in room phone was $40.00(I should have know better)

Reviews.Title: “Avarage”
Reviews.Author: Maya_tr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in NH Manin in December. The hotel is a 10 - 15 minutes walk from San Marco Square. Right next to the Grand Canale. The room was very dark and very cold when we arrived. It took a while to make it warmer. ( The building is a old stone house ). The breakfast is ok , the service is not bad. However ,other NH hotels I stayed were far better than this one. Don't expect a modern place. The hotel is just right for those who are looking for an old romantic venetian house. But don't stay at the first floor. Secomd floor rooms have a good view. The first floor is not good at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Very expensive”
Reviews.Author: elpidoforos
Reviews.Content: Hotel is literally on the Grand Canal. Had a room with a partial view of the canal. A/C was not working at all. When told the reception they promised to fix it but didnt. The window shutters were banging all around when not closed (!) so we had to keep them closed - so long for the partial view of the canal. We told the reception who promised to fix it but didnt (what a surprise). All that for nearly 300euros per night!

Reviews.Title: “It ticks all the boxes for a great city break hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Eliza20
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time in Venice- because of the weather, the food and our hotel. It was just perfect for what we wanted on our city break. It is spotlessly clean, has everything a hotel room should have and a few extras, and is literally located at San Angelo stop, so going to and from this hotel is easy and hassle- free. It seems to be centrally located, so one could head in one direction to St. Mark's Square and the other for shopping etc. The only negative, but this applies to Venice in general, is how easy it is to get lost so get a map, and bring it with you always, as you will end up walking everywhere. So it's nice to be able to find your way out of the little side street on which you will find yourself!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel by the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: uNF671
Reviews.Content: PROS: On the Grand Canal Right by a vaporetto stop (San Angeles) WiFi (paid) access CONS: (at the time) Facade Renovation Renowned Garden closed NOTES: We liked this hotel, although not being able to reserve a specific room in advance miffed me (they will only allow you to select a room class). 4/5! Great front desk staff. I had a load of questions before booking, and Angelo was very very helpful via email and phone. When we got there the signoras at the front desk are pleasant, professional in that they aren't TOO nice (One can attribute it to the famous Venetian attitude, but hey, it's Venice!), quick to offer recommendations (too quick, I think, but definitely welcomed) for restaurants in the area, and above all efficient. English was superb. 5/5! Bellstaff needed more training in how to operate the motorized wooden shutters. Very friendly though. 3/5. Room (we got the Suite with the Grand Canal View) was nice. The view, spectacular. The furnishings, great. Too bad there was a facade renovation going on, which we didn't mind as long as we can see the Grand Canal. We would have loved to have gotten the room to the left, which actually had a balcony. 4/5. Bathroom is great! Never seen anything like it, what with the green marble, well appointed, yet tiny... we liked it! 5/5. Breakfast was the best. Very very good. 5/5. FYI: Elevator is tiny!!!! We couldn't use the garden due to the facade maintenance. MAKE SURE TO ASK IN ADVANCE ABOUT THIS KIND OF STUFF!!! Next time we'd probably go try another hotel, but that's just how we roll. Otherwise I would have no qualms staying here again and again and again. Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful surrounds”
Reviews.Author: Peccorinos
Reviews.Content: NH Manin is a gorgeous hotel set right on the Grand Canal. It has a Vaporetto station right outside its door so getting around Venice is so convenient. The hotel has been restored and has marble everywhere, including the bathrooms. It has a gorgeous sun-deck out the back where you can sit outside and have a few drinks. Breakfasts are sensational - all yummy Italian food as expected. Rooms are relatively spacious and have Murano glass fittings everywhere. NH Manin is within walking distance to everything including the Rialto Bridge, San Marco Plaza, and the Bridge of Sighs. A beautiful stay. When we return to Venice, we plan on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yeadon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week while attending a music festival. The location couldn't be more convenient, being right by the vaporetto stop on the Grand Canal and it is only a 10-15 minute walk from the Rialto, Accademia Bridge and S Mark's Square. The staff were very pleasant and helpful, and even came to the room at tea-time to turn down the bed and draw the curtains. I had a single room with green marble floor and a well equipped en suite shower room. My only complaint would be that the room was a bit cold as the ceiling was very high and the heating came out of an air conditioning vent high up the wall and as we all know warm air rises. The a/c system was the only source of heat and as it was rather noisy I had to turn it off at night which meant a cold room in the morning. At a warmer time of year it wouldn't be a problem. The only English language channel on the TV is CNN. The breakfast buffet is very good and you can get coffee and warm snacks during the during the day, but there is no restaurant. Overall I enjoyed my stay here and would certainly go again.

Reviews.Title: “What a desappointment - small poorly decorated room”
Reviews.Author: TParis
Reviews.Content: I reserved a twin room, and I was first given a double room. Then they found a small poorly decorated room on the ground floor behind the reception with twin beds side by side (without any space between them) ! There was no privacy at all ! It was not at all up to the standard of a 4 stars hotel, and it was absolutely not worth 215 euros per night. Good breakfast thought, and good location near the Vaporetto stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at NH Manin”
Reviews.Author: cape2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the NH Manin July 18-20, 2008. Our room was average sized with a large closet and nice layout. The breakfast, included in our stay, was spectacular. Of the other hotels we stayed in during our trip in Italy, this had the absolute best selection of breakfast items, including 4 different juices, fruit, breads/croissants, hot items like sausage, eggs, meats, etc. and excellent coffee! It would be nice to have an option to make coffee in the room, but the overwhelming supply of options at breakfast certainly made up for this. The staff was extremely helpful and very welcoming. **If you are staying here, note that the vaporetto stops right at the hotel from the Sant' Angelo stop** The shower was rather small and like a previous review mentioned, the bathroom door did not close properly and left us with a wet floor each time we showered. I would certainly stay here again, as it was very close to St. Marks and we loved being on the grand canal, even though we didn't have a canal-side room. Also, the renovations are still going on with scaffolding around the exterior of the building so the courtyard is only open from 17:00 - 23:30.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in the Manin”
Reviews.Author: bnzlvr
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to the Manin on our trip to Italy last week because I thought we would enjoy being closer to the Rialto. The public areas of the hotel are beautiful, but the garden was closed for renovation and our room was not the greatest - no view, shabby headboard, tiny, and it had an odor suspiciously like urine the first night. The mattresses, pillows, and linens were a bit better than we had at other hotels, though far from luxurious. The bathroom was so-so (the shower door didn't close properly and the floor was always wet). It is very convenient to have the vaporetto at your doorstep, though, and I guess you have to keep in mind that the building is very old and it IS Venice. I just didn't think it was worth the additional $200/night over and above the price of our original hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but.”
Reviews.Author: Sunny078
Reviews.Content: Location was excellent, liked the Hotel very much and the staff were very helpful but :- One of the reasons we chose the Hotel was for the gardens, which they showed in the brochure and on their website, where one could have breakfast etc. Unfortunately on arrival we found that renovation work was going on at the Hotel and the gardens were closed. Although we booked several months in advance we were not advised about this. If you are thinking of using this Hotel it might be worth finding out if the renovation work has finished.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: sammyloo
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a super location, in the heart but not too busy or noisy. Standard (classic) double rooms are fine, with everything you need for a short break, considering the amount of time actually spent in them. Only thing could of done with is coffee/tea making facilites but there is room service if you are desperate. Rooms not overlooking the Grand canal have their advantages as they are quiet. Very friendly and helpful staff. Lots of choice for breakfast with very attentive staff. Alilaguna orange/brown line goes to the airport from directly outside this hotel (Sant' Angelo). Beats queueing with the rest of the world in St.Marks square....

Reviews.Title: “1st Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kazand
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after 3 nights stay at this amazing hotel, the location is perfect on the grand canal just 9 stops on the water bus from Plazza Roma. The staff were friendly and helpful, the breakfast was excellent with fresh fruit with a great selection too. Our room was large, clean and the views were breath taking (room 304) . Would highly recommend to friends! Rosa Rossa is a great place to eat where food was good value and the service is 2nd to none !! Very romantic city perfect place to get down on one knee as my partner did !! Will return to see the places we missed this time around. Karen and Andy - England

Reviews.Title: “Great city, shame about the Manin”
Reviews.Author: Leecb
Reviews.Content: I had a great time in Venice, all apart from the accommodation that is!!! Just like the last review I had booked up a Junior Suite Grand Canal view double room â€“ for 2 persons, only to be given my key, enter the room and find a standard twin room! After speaking to the receptionist I was told that all of the suites were fully booked and there were none left for me to stay in but they would upgrade us to a luxury double..... After waiting for a couple of hours for them to move rooms I went back to the reception to find there were no other rooms and all they could do is push the 2 single beds together. There was also no manager there until Monday. (How convenient as we left on the Monday) The staff were friendly at breakfast but that was about it. Great city but do avoid the Manin!!!

Reviews.Title: “Miserable at Manin”
Reviews.Author: EnterpriseGuru
Reviews.Content: Miserable at The Manin Well you read stories of unexpected upgrades but not downgrades. On checking in to the Manin we were informed that our junior suite grand canal view was not available but we had been given a garden room instead.The room we had booked would be available the following night. Hmm. The room had scuffed walls,two singles pushed together and confetti and hair grips on the floor. We went down for breakfast the following morning and the receptionist walked past us.We waited for the promised move-nothing was done so we checked out.Amazing.Our room was to be upgraded to a third floor suite.Too late. Others have had a good stay at this place,we did not.This is unacceptable when you pay upfront-or at any time. Whilst staff were pleasant at breakfast this hotel is rather drab and unwelcoming. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “First visit ot Venice”
Reviews.Author: Manin07
Reviews.Content: I took my l6 year old grandaughter to Venice for her first visit after her GCSE,s. Having only booked a standard room imagine my delight when we were showed to a first floor room with a huge balcony overlooking the grand canal - we also had a table and chairs and where we enjoyed the everchanging show which is the Grand Canal. Friendly hotel, attentive staff and a superb breakfast enjoyed in the garden. It was here I introduced Hannah my grandaugter to Prosecco at breakfast what a treat. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Venice

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: TEDCheshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Manin again this year, although only for 2 nights rather than the 5 nights last year. As it wasn't a special wedding aniversary we booked a regular room rather than a suite and were pleasantly surprised at how nice the room was. We did have a couple of issues with the bathroom as we were unable to use either the shower or the bath the first morning, but this was resolved the same day. The only down side is once again the hotel doesn't have a nice bar area to sit in. I'm sure its lovely to sit outside in the warmer weather but they do need somewhere better than the room used for breakfasts at night - it's not welcoming and is VERY expensive. Find a bar somewhere for a night cap!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: mcn_mi
Reviews.Content: my husband and I spent two nights at Manin in Venice during our time in Italy on our honeymoon. we chose this hotel because of it's location on the Grand Canal and because it's rated a 4-star. we were not disappointed. the room was beautiful and spacious, as was the bathroom. after traveling to several other cities and staying at satisfactory hotels, this was a pleasant surprise. the location on the Grand Canal is nice -- there's not much to look at from the front door or the room we had, but it's still within walking distance of restaurants, etc. there's no straight shot down the canal - you have to weave through the mazes of nearby buildings and make your way back to the canal and the sidewalks. we were about 10 mins from the Rialto and a good 20-25 mins from St. Mark's. lots to see in between though, so we enjoyed the walk. breakfast was quite good - offering the usual spread of breads, meats, cheeses, cereal, coffee and juices. the morning we checked out, we had to catch an early flight and they were kind enough to prepare to-go breakfast for us. I'm not sure we'll visit Venice again, but if we do, I'd definitely stay here. *Venice travel tip - if you have an early flight departing from Marco Polo, you can either choose to stay at a hotel close to the aiport or else, be sure to leave a good hour and a half early (before you have to be there) to utilize public transportation (water bus, land bus). water taxis are also an option, but they can be quite expensive. we were quoted 100 euro for a an early morning ride to the airport. we opted for the bus at 9 euro each!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: roxanneEDH
Reviews.Content: The hotel has large rooms and is very clean. We were unfortunately sick so we didn't get enjoy our room overlooking the canal or Venice too much. But, the staff was friendly and the location was great! Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant start to honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: timnicebutdim
Reviews.Content: We booked a canal facing suite for the first leg of our Italian honeymoon and we were very pleased with the room. The Manin is a small friendly hotel, in a great location. Ok, it's not the Cipriani with 5 star costly extras but hey, staying in Venice is all about the room not the hotel IMHO. Our suite was large enough for our needs. Very clean with a great view. Attentive and pleasant staff. Breakfast in the courtyard garden was a rare treat in Venice. My advice - it's better to get a suite in a 4 star than a broom cupboard in a 5 star......

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: alangee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Manin from 4 - 7 August 2007 and we loved every moment of our holiday at this hotel. We booked a junior suite (room 304) which is at the very topof the hotel and with a balcony an incredible 8 metres or more long with outstanding views up and down the Grand Canal including the Rialto Bridge which is about a 15min walk away. The room / bathroom was spotlessly clean with linen, towels etc changed every day. All of the staff were extremely friendly both on arrival and throughout our stay and were a credit to the Hotel itself and the Framon Group who administer a number of hotels including the Mainin. The Hotel has its own landing stage and having seen many people dragging suitcases across bridges and through winding alleyways etc to other hotels this was a real asset. We chose to book water taxis each way from the airport to hotel and although a little pricey we felt it was worth every penny , apart from being hassle free its also an exciting and unforgettable way to arrive. The hotel also has the advantage of being right next to a vaporetti (water bus) landing stage which is a cheap way of travelling through the canals. There is a little noise from the vaporetti but these do not run during the night and we found them an added interest rather than an intrusion. A good breakfast is available in the sunny / shady parasoled small garden and there are a few tables inside. I am conscious that previous commentators mentioned seating problems but we found no problems whatsoever. I would advise a good map , which the manager helpfully supplied, since it is remarkably easy to get lost particularly when coming back in the dark after a meal with more wine than is sensible ! Lastly, if funds allow do try a gondola. We did it on a quiet sunday afternoon and it was wonderful. However, avoid at all costs sitting down for a coffee / drink in St Marks Square when the orchestras are playing in the evening, its obscenely expensive and simply not worth it. I would not hesitate to stay at the Manin again and would recommend it to anyone. Regret that no photos are available , my brand new digital camera didn't work on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: flashwagon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the "penthouse" suite. It is the top floor suite with loooong balcony that over looks the grand canal. They do have a very small elevator to get to the room which is helpful. The bed does not look out over the canal as there is a small step to get out to the rooftop balcony, but the view is spectacular and you are up above the river traffic noise. The bathroom in long and narrow and adequate. The decor is lovely. The best part is that the hotel is just a step off of the Vaporetta. But do note, this Vaporettta stop is not part of the night runs, so if you are out late at night, you will have to get off early and walk through the winding alleys late at night. We felt safe and had no problem with it, but just a heads up. Breakfast was more than adequate, better than most European breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: h2murphy
Reviews.Content: this hotel is lovely in service and accomodations. convenient for water taxi's being on the grand canal. not as close as i thought to other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacers1
Reviews.Content: This was a very charming hotel. Clean, nice size rooms. They have a garden terrace, library and lounge. Another reviewer complained that there was not enough tables for seatings. We had no problem. Right outside is the a water bus stop. It's a nice ten minute walk to St. Mark's Square. Would defintely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worthed it!”
Reviews.Author: Vasileios_Barpakis
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Manin Hotel on the last weekend of April for our one year anniversary. We did not ask for a room with a view over the Grand Canal as it was more expensive so our room had a view over Venetian rooftops. Apart from that, the room was big enough, extremely clean offering all the amenities promised. The location is excellent, next to the St Angelo vaporetto stop and within walking distance of all major sites and best places to wander around at night. The buffet breakfast is great both in quantity and quality. The best part, however is having it on the hotel's garden. It is so beautiful in the mornign with the sun...I will always remember it! Hotel did their best to make us feel comfortable and helped me a lot in surprising my spouse with flowers and breakfast in our room on our anniversary. I did not mind not taking a room with a view, as we were wandering all day and preffered to spend my money elsewhere. The one thing that I did mind was a bit of noise. Not from the vaporettos as many suggest but from pigeons on the roof (our room was on the 3rd floor). Concluding I would stay again here for their freindliness, help, clean and spacious rooms and WC and their lovely breakfast garden.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive”
Reviews.Author: arsenal7533
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Hotel Manin. We booked a suite overlooking the Canal. Great Hotel location. Great view from the room. However the room was far from being spotless. Some lamps were broken, craks on the walls, dust on the furniture. Tiny small bathroom. The suite is really overpriced. Staff is very helpfull and nice. Breakfast is quite poor with a very limited choice.

Reviews.Title: “nice small hotel but just OK”
Reviews.Author: gsdoc4kids
Reviews.Content: we stayed here april 2007. There are many positives including the convenience of a next door vaporetto stop, central location in venice for walking to all areas, and a very nice friendly OUTDOOR environment for breakfast. We were thankfully upgraded, without asking, for no additional price. The rooms however are average at best. Even the junior suite we stayed in needed repairs, had an odd setup for the tub ( in the bedroom behind a screen and without any shower curtain: soaked the place), and certainly was not fancy. Note that the rates for this hotel are very high compared to other european destinations. The room was however clean as were all the other public areas. Breakfast was average but good. Service was ok but varied. Many front desk staff were not as knowledgeable, but they tried to help. Others were not as helpful. Overall I would rate our experience as average for this probably overpriced hotel. Its main plus is location on the canal(great for water taxi to/from airport), and quiet convenient location overall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevjvek
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in September. Overall this was a very nice hotel. Although fairly expensive (~$500/night) we had a room right on the Grand Canal (with two small balconies) with views of the Rialto. The room itself was pretty large, although the bathroom was very small (one person at a time, please). One of the highlights is the breakfast garden out back. They have a nice selection of food (eggs, ham, fruit, biscuits, pastries, juices, etc.--nothing overly spectacular, but decent), but the garden is a sublime place to start the day. The location is good, right at a vaporetto stop (although this could be a little noisy at times, it wasn't too disruptive), but in a nice quiet area of San Marco. Walking it's about 10 minutes to the Piazza San Marco, 7 minutes to the Rialto, and about 7 minutes to Ponte dell'Accademia. Or you can hop on the vaporetto and be just about anywhere in a few minutes. All in all, a comfortable stay and friendly staff--we would definitely stay here again (maybe just for the breakfast and garden alone).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, superb location”
Reviews.Author: veniceloverLiverpool
Reviews.Content: My Husband Francesco (who is Italian) and I stayed at the Manin Hotel for four nights in December 2006. We had never spent Christmas in Venice before so it was a very special time of the year to see Venice once again, as we have been to Venice several times before. We stayed in a Junior Suite overlooking the Grand Canal with exceptional views of the Grand Canal and Rialto Bridge. The room itself was exceptional and cleaned very well everyday. The breakfast was a buffet style and was very good. The Hotel staff were very friendly, and polite, like Pierluca Cecchini, but particularly Paolo Vianello, on Reception , who was exceptionally helpful, professional and friendly and in our opinion is an asset to the Hotel Manin. Even though my Husband, Francesco, is Italian and obviously spoke to Paolo in Italian, Paolo still made the effort to speak to me in English. We are looking forwards to seeing him again when we return to Venice. There are also very good Restaurants in the area, particularly the â€œLa Feluca Ristoranteâ€� in Calle della Mandola, which is only a few minutes walk away, walking from the back of the Manin Hotel. The food is excellent and very varied and the staff are extremely friendly and attentive. Overall, we were both very happy with the Hotel Manin and are planning to return in August. We would highly recommend this Hotel, in fact we have done so already and my Sister, her Husband and 12 year old daughter, on our recommendation, will be staying at the Manin Hotel, Venice for their Silver Wedding Anniversary in August 07. Isabella, Liverpool, UK

Reviews.Title: “excellent and very central”
Reviews.Author: mother1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Junior suite with my mum,/ 12/15 march. weather was absolutely fantastic, everything about the hotel was excellent.The free posh water taxi to Maurano was an unexpected pleasure.The water bus stop outside the hotel ace, take a walk behind the hotel and explore all the little allies that lead to a shoppers paradise.I did find 2 cocktails,ham & friut salad and tomatoe & mozzerella costing Â£35 (british) at the hotal as a snack the dearest meal we had on the island.When checking out we had to wait 45minutes for our luggage to come from the room behind, just as well we left hotel 1 hour earlier than planned.These are the only 2 critisisms we have on what was a fabulous stay.Definately return there.The Welsh visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Views, but overall Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ems1073
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Manin two weeks ago, on a mother/daughter break for 4 nights, we had been recommended by a friend to stay at this hotel. You cannot fault the location of the hotel - its in a lovely spot on the Grand Canal, St Angelo Vaporetto stop is right outside, and you are in easy walking distance of all the sights. The rooms were clean and beautifully appointed - we had a Junior Suite with a view of the canal - but it was on the small side, with little storage and the bathroom was tiny. The public areas of the hotel are also nice, and the breakfast was good, with a wide selection and even complimentary Prosecco if you felt like it! I can't quite put my finger on why I came away disappointed...the hotel didnt have the x-factor I expect for 300 euros a night. The staff in reception were pretty apathetic, they answered questions but didn't offer any additional information or go the extra mile. One night the hotel offered complimentary drinks between 5-7pm to compensate for the water supply being turned off that morning - we arrived back from sightseeing at 8pm and asked if we could have our free drink, and we were told no, we'd missed our chance. But the bar was open, and it would have been no effort to give us two free glasses of wine! Overall, Hotel Manin is fine, and the location is great. But there is no buzz about the place, no real feeling of hospitality, and definitely none of the charm and joy of real Italy.

Reviews.Title: “loved our stay at the Manin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pegmurr
Reviews.Content: staff were friendly and helpfull. Stayed in junior suite overlooking canal, lovely room, bed turndown one night of 3?! Extensive selection in mini bar but tea/coffee making facility would have been appreciated.breakfasts were well catered for ie fruit/juices/cold meat , cheese selection and breads,and champagne if you felt inclined!! A hot selection was also available but you had to investigate to find. The patio area looked lovely but we were there 18th to 21st March and the weather was not conducive to eating outside. Hotel easy to find if first time in Venice. Would stay there again, must mention Giorgio the bar manager who was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: whales44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last week and it was such a nice stay. The location is fabulous and the vaporatto stop is right in front of the hotel. Doesn't mean you won't get lost all the time, but that's ok! We had a deluxe double room, which gave us partial views of the grand canal. It was so nice and soooo quiet. The rooms are smaller and less grand than they look online, but that was ok. They were fine. The beds were ok, not great, but doable. The bathroom has a funny shower which sprays everywhere, but I guess that's what they do. The windows opened and there was heat and AC. Breakfast is included and that was very nice. You could eat indoors or out on the terrace. The staff was fabulous and helpful and just the best! We recommend this hotel and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: Nickynackynoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Manin Hotel the weekend of 9th March. The hotel was lovely, in a good position but a little pricey. We had an executive room with a partial view of the canal. The room was very small and the bathroom tiny but very nicely decorated and clean. We had a huge balcony with a great view over the Grand Canal but unfotunately the Vaporetti stop is directly outside this hotel. A perk when you arrive but unfortunately a little noisey in the evening unless you are above floor 1 (we were in room 101). Luckily the windows had shutters which came in very useful. The balcony did make up for the size of room though and was lovely to sit out on during the day. The hotel staff were very pleasant and the breakfast was very good. I had read many reports prior to our visit all of which described extremely difficult procedures of getting to the Hotel which was most definately not the case. We chose to arrive by bus. The ticket office is clearly sign-posted to the left once you walk out of the arrivals in the airport. You need a ticket for bus No. 5 Piazza Roma. Walk across the road from the airport to the bus stop no. 5 and then directly off the bus at the main stop (Piazza Roma) then catch the waterbus to S'Angelo which stops directly outside the hotel. Overall view of the city itself was slightly disappointing as it is so commercial (We often saw traffic jams of gondola's which somehow took away the romance!) We also found the hotel did lack any atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel in an Amazing City!”
Reviews.Author: vic1721
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I stayed at the Manin in December 2006 for 3 nights. We stayed in the Junior Suite overlooking the Grand Canal with views of the Rialto and I cannot even begin to describe that view! The room itself was exceptionally well kitted out, especially for a city hotel and they were cleaned well everyday. The decor was beautiful and made you very aware that you were in Venice, which just added to the whole experience. The hotel staff were extremely polite and very helpful with any questions we asked. Every inch of the hotel was spotless and breakfast was a simple buffet but perfectly adequate. The location of the hotel was great, next door to a water bus stop this meant that you didnt have to walk far if your legs were tired! It is a great central location for all the sites and very easy to find! Overall, we were both extremely happy with the hotel and are planning to return next year. Yes, it is a little pricy but I think it is worth every penny and if you can afford it, go for the junior suite because it truly is an amazing room with breathtaking views!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: parny
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel fo 3 nights ans opted for a junior suite. The room we were given was fantastic and had its own verander (approx 10 meteres long) overlooking the grand cannal. The hotels staff are very freindly and polite and will order you a water taxi on request (very expensive 80E one way to Airport, but worth every cent!!) Breakfast was a buffet style and was very good. There is a water bus stop outside of the hotel which is handy, but the buses get very, very full, so we tended just to wander around and get lost quite often. Room was comfortable, a bit rough in places but then thats venice!! Would highly recommend this hotel, and if you want a truly unique experience try and get the suite with the big Ballcony / Verander (see photos) and watch the eveyday goings on with a bottle (or two) of wine.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little hotel - but very expensive.”
Reviews.Author: grethe
Reviews.Content: It was such a nice little hotel in great surroundings. Very convenient to San Marco, and the waterbus - Vaporette - stopped just outside the hotel. Furnished with antiques, very small rooms and bathrooms. Very clean and extremely helpful and polite staff.The breakfastroom, and especially the breakfast in the little garden was great. We had asked for a room viewing the canal, and we did get it ! But on the ground floor, so the window was actually high up on the wall, and outside was a little fence. So we did not really have the canal view. So what we did to sit and relax and look at the canal and it`s traffic, was to bring our wine outside and sit down at the quay and enjoyed life. So, if you want to have the view - ask for a room from the first floor and upwards !! Excellent hotel, but as everything else in Venice- very overpriced - even to a Norwegian. But i would for sure stay at the hotel another time.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Chicago7
Reviews.Content: Manin Hotel is very charming. The lobby spills over to the canal. The illusion that you step right outside in the water. Only an illusion. There is a narrow walkway in between. The building has an exquisite character. Very formal and homey at the same time. The lobby area is beautifully appointed, adjacent to the lobby is an elegant library room. Breakfast is served at an outside terrace. Hotel staff is helpful and polite. The rooms are beautifully decorated. The hotel is very quite. We traveled there during the busy vacation time. The location is superb. You are right next to a vapporetto stop. Walking distance from Rialto Bridge area and San Marco Piazza. Highly recommended. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FHWNPW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the 1st week in December for 3 nights. The room was clean and tidy overlooking the canal. The hotel is in a great location only 10 mins walk to St Marks Square once you find the way. The hotel provided complimentary bubbly for my husbands Birthday which was very much appreciated. A very good hotel, Venice is beautiful and we had an excellent time

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: benbr
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading trip adviser reviews. Excellent position on Grand Canal. Room had long balcony with front giving great views, the Rialto. Booked direct thro' hotel website. 4 nights at 536 euros was excellent value. Continental breakfast was excellent with unlimited choice. All Hotel staff were courteous and friendly. The reception manager even left a bottle of bubbly in our room when he knew it was my wife's birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: QueenMimi
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel on the Grand canal. In reality, it is not quite as it appears in the pictures. The furnishings and such are really those of a lower class hotel. Our room was next to the area that they use for breakfast and a bar. We were awakened at 6:45 a.m. to the sounds of the preparation for breakfast. The noise sounded as if they were in the room with us. At 10:30 at night, we heard the sounds of them putting away the elements of the bar. The conversations of the people above us were heard. Everything was magnified like in an echo chamber. We were only there for two nights, otherwise I would have asked for a room change. They have a lovely, relaxing reading room. We enjoyed it while waiting to leave for the train station. The people who work there and the location are excellent. Framon hotels that owns this needs to put some money into this hotel and make it the excellent hotel it could be, but is not right now. Things needed painting, there were huge water stains on the ceiling from the bathroom upstairs. There was mold in the bathroom shower. We will not be returning unless significant changes are made.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: w62
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few months ago. It's a great wee hotel, right on the Grand Canal and by St Angelo waterbus stop. Rooms are clean and airy - although I would ask for one on a high floor. We had a wonderful view of the canal. It's in a really good location - only 5 mins from St Mark's Square. Staff are friendly and breakfast is good. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel and very expensive for what you get...”
Reviews.Author: rochelle.alexis
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great and in a great location. As most hotels in Venice, this hotel was very expensive for what we got. We did the "taste of Venice" package that was available from their website. Breakfast was fine and it was nice getting a small bottle of wine in our room when we arrived. The package also included a 3 day waterbus pass, a water taxi to Murano Island (but, NOT back from the island), a 'tour' of the murano factory (if you could call it that, basically they were just trying to sell us stuff) and a "gift certificate" for 2 different restaurants that included a glass of wine and a few tapas at each... First of all, no one new where one of the restaurants were - it felt as if they purposely didn't want us to find it. Then when we went to look for it ourselves, other shop owners near where the restaurant was supposed to be, had never heard of it. Very annoying. The rooms were fine, actually, pretty nice for Italian standards. The beds were extremely hard. But, it was clean and the shower had good pressure. The location was great, once you could fine your way around :-). Make sure you get a good map! Definitely take advantage of the "Traghetto" - there is one very close to the hotel's front door. The Traghetto will take you straight across the Grand Canal in a gondola for about .50C Euro a person. To get to the Traghetti's follow the yellow gondola signs toward the water and there are usually stops near them! The Traghetti are a faster easy way to get across the Grand Canal than some of the water buses. I really think this hotel is as good as any in Italy. I don't think less expensive options exist without lowering your standards. Have a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a place & great location”
Reviews.Author: Monica A
Reviews.Content: This beautiful gem has a great location and is adjacent to the San Angelo vaporetto stop. While you are seated, in it's small elegant lobby, you can see an unobstructed view of the Grand Canal. (My photo doesn't do it justice). The rooms are small but include amenities of a bidet, tub, and cabinet space for two. Linens, carpets, drapes were all in very good condition and clean. We had a couple of concerns like a missing makeup mirror and chair that wasn't taken care of very quickly but that was fairly minor. Our breakfast was included and was very substantial: yogurts, fruit, pastries, meats, eggs, juices, great coffee and several cheeses. Take some time to relax in their garden cafe where they serve wine, coffee and snacks until late in the evening. Staff are cordial, but not overly friendly, but were helpful with questions we had. The Hotel Manin was within a 10-15 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge and there are a couple of interesting piazza's and shops to meander through before getting to the Rialto so it might take you longer. It was great to be close to a vaporetto stop, especially after a long day of sight seeing. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great service, super location”
Reviews.Author: kazmodo
Reviews.Content: We visited three cities on our Italian tour (Rome, Florence and Venice) -- this hotel had the nicest people-- it was also the most costly, way more than I usually spend on a hotel, but Venice is expensive everywhere. The room was welcoming, good beds, pillows, AC, bathroom, shutters made room very dark and easy to sleep. Breakfast had many choices and was served on a quaint patio. Best of this hotel is the location-- we walked everywhere, and there were great restaurants and shops, and they were just far enough away from the tourist ares that they were high quality. The best was that the vaparetto stop was outside the front door. After a long train ride, and pre a long flight, this was very welcomed that we didn't have to drag our bags across cobblestones and bridges. Venice is beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sherik
Reviews.Content: At the beginning of our wonderful 3 night stay at the Framon Hotel Manin, the very first night we were in Venice my husband had his wallet pickpocketed. What a terrible experience!!! It was on the crowded number 1 vaporetto right before our Hotel stop at St. Angelo, so please be aware!!! He had his wallet in his front pocket, and had his hand in his pocket most of the time, but for a few seconds he took it out to hang onto the side rail of the vaporetto just to keep his balance. The thief was apparently stalking him and watching him every minute! We were completely and totally shocked and felt very taken advantage of. As we got off the vaporetto and headed a few feet to the hotel, he noticed it was missing. The boat was just leaving the stop, and the thief probably was watching him feel his pants pockets for his missing wallet!!! We just felt so violated. At that point we weren't sure what to do, as this had never happened to us, so we were just so shook up. Luckily I still had my credit cards in my purse with me, so the phone numbers of who to call were on the back of the cards. But we were in a foreign country, and we didn't even know if the 1-800 numbers would work in Italy. At the Hotel Manin, we immediately spoke with Mr. Pierluca Cecchini, the Reception Manager. He helped us so much, he was so calming and so nice. He was extremely professional, and he made us feel so thankful that he was standing there behind that counter. He calmed us down, and told us that he would help us take care of everything and not to worry. Then he actually made several international phone calls to the credit card companies from his desk, and handed the phone to my husband each time so that he could report the cards stolen. We offered to pay for the cost of the phone calls, but he declined. Although we lost quite a bit of money that night in his wallet, it could have been so much worse if the thief would have been able to use our credit cards also. Thanks to Mr. Cecchini that did not happen. I can't say enough about how helpful he was to us, and how much we appreciate all that he did. All the wonderful things that people have written about this hotel are true, and in addition to all of those was the extraordinary service that we received that night when we felt at our most nervous and most stressed. When we visit Venice again, you can be assured that we will stay at the Framon Hotel Manin. We know from experience that they go out of their way to take EXCEPTIONAL care of their hotel guests!!!

Reviews.Title: “womderful suite”
Reviews.Author: egroegdrof
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as the first part of our two week honeymoon. We arrived at 11.30ish on a Sunday night but the reception desk were lovely. Our room (junior suite with grande canal view) was amazing. The suite was huge and very nicely decorated. Champagne and flowers awaiting us. Two doors opened out to two seperate baloncies (very small but nice) overlooking the Canal and upto the Rialto bridge. Breakfast int he garden out the back lovely and friendly staff. Located right next to a water bus sop was very convinent and not as noisy as it sounds. Would definatley visit this hotel again and reccommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, convenient hotel on Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: vabelle77
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here last year for 2 days. The other reviewers are right on about how wonderful it is. Here's some things you may not know: the entrance is beautiful, with (Murano) glass chandeliers and gorgeous furnishings. The rooms have orginial hardwood and our room had ceiling beams.The staff makes a wicked Panini (love it with salami and cheese) that they fixed for us every night around 10:00. Stocked mini fridge in room was a nice touch. They also have a lovely courtyard where we enjoyed fantastic coffee and breakfast. Wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but room name misleading”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on reviews from this site. I would agree that the hotel has a good location and nice breakfast area. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The vaporetto stop is right outside the hotel door, which is very convenient. I booked a junior-suite with a Grand Canal view, and the room, while spacious and comfortable was on the side of the hotel, so our Grand Canal view was really a small partial view if you stuck your head out the window and looked left. Worth noting is that the hotel does not offer any type of internet connection (wireless or wired) and there were no movies available in-room (Venice is not a nightlife city). I would probably try a different place our next stay in Venice. I really enjoyed the water-taxi to the airport, which was expensive (90 Euros) but is by far the coolest airport connection we have ever taken.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ColonelS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here whilst getting married in Venice in May. I can;t reccomend this hotel enough. We had a deluxe room for two nights, which was lovely and spacious ( a rarity in Venice) and for the last three nights, celebrated our wedding by hiring the suite. For the amount we paid this was absolutely stunning value. The suite has a 50 foot roof terrace with amazing views over the Grand Canal - perfect for watcing the world go by and getting some sun. The staff were really friendly, the rooms were clean and well equiped and the location is spot on. It is a 10 minute walk to St Marks or Rialto. and the ferry station is right outside the front door.It also has a lovely courtyard which is perfect for either breakfast ( the breakfasts are really good) in the sun or a late night drink.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a treat for my mother's birthday after reading reviews on this site and I have to say I was not disapointed. A few days before our trip, I rang to arrange for a bottle of Prosseco and a bouquet of flowers to be left in the room for her arrival. The staff were more than helpful on the phone and as soon as we arrived at the hotel they discretly pointed out (without my mother hearing) that all had been arranged as requested. Sure enough when she checked into her room, a beautiful vase containing a stunning bouquet of flowers and a bottle of chilled fizz were there to welcome her (and it didn't cost an arm and a leg either). We took a water taxi from the airport (90 EUROS) although if you are traveling alone or are a bit strapped for cash it is simple to use the Water Buses and there is a stop right outside the hotel, so no walking involved. You catch both from the same place, which is a short walk (5-10 mins tops) from the airport terminal...if you are capable of a small stroll, just turn left when you get out of the airport doors and follow the signs to water buses and taxis. The gentleman on reception, Paulo was more than helpful and as our room was not ready having arrived early morning, had our bags taken to a storage room and furnished us with maps and directions so be could begin our sightseeing. He also was most obliging when asked any questions and more than helpful to recommend restaurants to suit all tastes and budgets. We booked 2 rooms one delux double and one regular and although the regular was fine, it was well worth paying the extra for the delux, which although only had a view of the gardens was very spacious, spotlessly clean and beautifully decorated. There is a separate sitting area where you can have drinks and relax too. The ordinary room was in a ventilation shaft in the centre of the hotel and was very dark, fairly wee and very warm, with no view at all but having said that, if that's all your budget can manage it's fine as you only sleep in it or spend an hour or 2 there before going out etc. It was very clean and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast was more than adequate with bacon, eggs, pastries, cold meats, cheese, fresh fruit etc and the staff were delightful. If I had to find one negative point with the hotel it was the barman, who was most reluctant to provide a dish of ice for the room (I went to the bar to ask for one.... didn't expect room service or anything) There are no ice machines, so unless they expect you to drink warm drinks from the mini bar there is no alternative. We would have had a drink in the bar, but never saw a soul in it so decided to drink in the comfort of our own room. The location is perfect, slap bang between the Rialto Bridge and Saint Mark's Square. One thing I would strongly recommend is a trip out to the Islands of Murrano to see the glass shops, then from there go to Burrano which is the more beautiful of the islands. The houses are brightly coloured and it looks stunning on a sunny day. It is alot quieter than Venice itself and makes a welcome break from the hustle and bustle. Have lunch at De Romano, the food is excellent. On the mainland, you must have dinner at Aqua Pazza which is in the square right behind the hotel. Ask for the special desert, which is ice cream and sorbets served in the skins of the fruit they have been made from...doesn't sound very special but trust me...it's amazing.
